page.title: 08The Old Ferry Crossing, Aust
page.content: About three-quarters of a mile from the centre of Aust is Old Passage. Before the opening of the Severn Road Bridge in 1966 there was a regular ferry service which carried passengers and vehicles across the River Severn to Beachley. To have travelled via Gloucester would have meant an additional sixty mile journey. Old passage is now largely a derelict site although it is still possible to see the remains of the old car jetty, ticket office and cafe. It is obvious no effort has been made to preserve the site as an historical monument for future generations. Adjacent to the old ferry is Old Passage House,an imposing building which was once an inn but has now been modernised and is a private dwelling house.
